<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Move the instruction after an InsertPoint to the beginning of another</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><Highlight kind="comment">/// BasicBlock.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The instructions after \\p IP are moved to the beginning of \\p New which must</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><Highlight kind="comment">/// not have any PHINodes. If \\p CreateBranch is true, a branch instruction to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\p New will be added such that there is no semantic change. Otherwise, the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\p IP insert block remains degenerate and it is up to the caller to insert a</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><Highlight kind="comment">/// insert location will stick to after the instruction before the insertion</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><Highlight kind="comment">/// point (instead of moving with the instruction the InsertPoint stores</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><Highlight kind="comment">/// internally).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Split a BasicBlock at an InsertPoint, even if the block is degenerate</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><Highlight kind="comment">/// (missing the terminator).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><Highlight kind="comment">/// llvm::SplitBasicBlock and BasicBlock::splitBasicBlock require a well-formed</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><Highlight kind="comment">/// BasicBlock. \\p Name is used for the new successor block. If \\p CreateBranch</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><Highlight kind="comment">/// is true, a branch to the new successor will new created such that</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><Highlight kind="comment">/// semantically there is no change; otherwise the block of the insertion point</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><Highlight kind="comment">/// remains degenerate and it is the caller&#39;s responsibility to insert a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><Highlight kind="comment">/// terminator. Returns the new successor block.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Captures attributes that affect generating LLVM-IR using the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><Highlight kind="comment">/// OpenMPIRBuilder and related classes. Note that not all attributes are</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><Highlight kind="comment">/// required for all classes or functions. In some use cases the configuration</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><Highlight kind="comment">/// is not necessary at all, because because the only functions that are called</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><Highlight kind="comment">/// are ones that are not dependent on the configuration.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/openmpirbuilderconfig"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/openmpirbuilderconfig/#a700297913ed317f4442b189b1efdd454">OpenMPIRBuilderConfig</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">:</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Flag to define whether to generate code for the role of the OpenMP host</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// (if set to false) or device (if set to true) in an offloading context. It</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// is set when the -fopenmp-is-target-device compiler frontend option is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// specified.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/openmpirbuilderconfig/#a22e985ea690b791910dc19186b63cc37"><Highlight kind="normal">  std::optional&lt;bool&gt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/openmpirbuilderconfig/#a22e985ea690b791910dc19186b63cc37">IsTargetDevice</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Flag for specifying if the compilation is done for an accelerator. It is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// set according to the architecture of the target triple and currently only</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// true when targeting AMDGPU or NVPTX. Today, these targets can only perform</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the role of an OpenMP target device, so &#96;IsTargetDevice&#96; must also be true</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// if &#96;IsGPU&#96; is true. This restriction might be lifted if an accelerator-</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// like target with the ability to work as the OpenMP host is added, or if</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the capabilities of the currently supported GPU architectures are</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// expanded.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/openmpirbuilderconfig/#a24001aad64c43839eee308e15ad21166"><Highlight kind="normal">  std::optional&lt;bool&gt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/openmpirbuilderconfig/#a24001aad64c43839eee308e15ad21166">IsGPU</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00503" /><CodeLine lineNumber="503"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Initialize the internal state, this will put structures types and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00504" /><CodeLine lineNumber="504"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// potentially other helpers into the underlying module. Must be called</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00505" /><CodeLine lineNumber="505"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// before any other method and only once! This internal state includes types</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00570" /><CodeLine lineNumber="570"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Callback type for body (=inner region) code generation</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00571" /><CodeLine lineNumber="571"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00572" /><CodeLine lineNumber="572"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The callback takes code locations as arguments, each describing a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00573" /><CodeLine lineNumber="573"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// location where additional instructions can be inserted.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00574" /><CodeLine lineNumber="574"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00575" /><CodeLine lineNumber="575"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The CodeGenIP may be in the middle of a basic block or point to the end of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00576" /><CodeLine lineNumber="576"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// it. The basic block may have a terminator or be degenerate. The callback</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00577" /><CodeLine lineNumber="577"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// function may just insert instructions at that position, but also split the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00578" /><CodeLine lineNumber="578"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// block (without the Before argument of BasicBlock::splitBasicBlock such</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00579" /><CodeLine lineNumber="579"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// that the identify of the split predecessor block is preserved) and insert</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00580" /><CodeLine lineNumber="580"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// additional control flow, including branches that do not lead back to what</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00581" /><CodeLine lineNumber="581"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// follows the CodeGenIP. Note that since the callback is allowed to split</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00582" /><CodeLine lineNumber="582"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the block, callers must assume that InsertPoints to positions in the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00583" /><CodeLine lineNumber="583"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// BasicBlock after CodeGenIP including CodeGenIP itself are invalidated. If</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00584" /><CodeLine lineNumber="584"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// such InsertPoints need to be preserved, it can split the block itself</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00585" /><CodeLine lineNumber="585"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// before calling the callback.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00586" /><CodeLine lineNumber="586"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00587" /><CodeLine lineNumber="587"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// AllocaIP and CodeGenIP must not point to the same position.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00588" /><CodeLine lineNumber="588"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00589" /><CodeLine lineNumber="589"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param AllocaIP is the insertion point at which new alloca instructions</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00590" /><CodeLine lineNumber="590"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                 should be placed. The BasicBlock it is pointing to must</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00591" /><CodeLine lineNumber="591"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                 not be split.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00592" /><CodeLine lineNumber="592"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param CodeGenIP is the insertion point at which the body code should be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00593" /><CodeLine lineNumber="593"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                  placed.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00594" /><CodeLine lineNumber="594"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00595" /><CodeLine lineNumber="595"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\return an error, if any were triggered during execution.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00596" /><CodeLine lineNumber="596" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/openmpirbuilder/#a49e35e3ee470add16efcde1ab5d5556b"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">using </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/openmpirbuilder/#a49e35e3ee470add16efcde1ab5d5556b">BodyGenCallbackTy</a> =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00597" /><CodeLine lineNumber="597"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function-ref">function&#95;ref</a>&lt;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ac226f3d2b9ca090171a8e0a8cb92c343a902b0d55fddef6f8d651fe1035b7d4bd">Error</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/openmpirbuilder/#aafc1886793b898052f87edd7e9fdbaa3">InsertPointTy</a> AllocaIP, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/openmpirbuilder/#aafc1886793b898052f87edd7e9fdbaa3">InsertPointTy</a> CodeGenIP)&gt;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00598" /><CodeLine lineNumber="598"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00599" /><CodeLine lineNumber="599"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This is created primarily for sections construct as llvm::function&#95;ref</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00600" /><CodeLine lineNumber="600"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// (BodyGenCallbackTy) is not storable (as described in the comments of</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00601" /><CodeLine lineNumber="601"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// function&#95;ref class - function&#95;ref contains non-ownable reference</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00603" /><CodeLine lineNumber="603"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00604" /><CodeLine lineNumber="604"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\return an error, if any were triggered during execution.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00605" /><CodeLine lineNumber="605" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/openmpirbuilder/#a761a2c853c1d16b33e4e8c565ce0ca45"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">using </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/openmpirbuilder/#a761a2c853c1d16b33e4e8c565ce0ca45">StorableBodyGenCallbackTy</a> =</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00607" /><CodeLine lineNumber="607"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00621" /><CodeLine lineNumber="621"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Callback type for variable privatization (think copy &amp; default</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00622" /><CodeLine lineNumber="622"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// constructor).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00623" /><CodeLine lineNumber="623"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00624" /><CodeLine lineNumber="624"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param AllocaIP is the insertion point at which new alloca instructions</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00625" /><CodeLine lineNumber="625"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                 should be placed.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00626" /><CodeLine lineNumber="626"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param CodeGenIP is the insertion point at which the privatization code</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00627" /><CodeLine lineNumber="627"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                  should be placed.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00628" /><CodeLine lineNumber="628"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param Original The value being copied/created, should not be used in the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00629" /><CodeLine lineNumber="629"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                 generated IR.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00630" /><CodeLine lineNumber="630"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param Inner The equivalent of \\p Original that should be used in the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00631" /><CodeLine lineNumber="631"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///              generated IR; this is equal to \\p Original if the value is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00632" /><CodeLine lineNumber="632"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///              a pointer and can thus be passed directly, otherwise it is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00633" /><CodeLine lineNumber="633"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///              an equivalent but different value.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00634" /><CodeLine lineNumber="634"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param ReplVal The replacement value, thus a copy or new created version</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00635" /><CodeLine lineNumber="635"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                of \\p Inner.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00636" /><CodeLine lineNumber="636"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00637" /><CodeLine lineNumber="637"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\returns The new insertion point where code generation continues and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00638" /><CodeLine lineNumber="638"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///          \\p ReplVal the replacement value.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00639" /><CodeLine lineNumber="639" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/openmpirbuilder/#a71b5ba020f68829f5a1fd99f48b63d42"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">using </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/openmpirbuilder/#a71b5ba020f68829f5a1fd99f48b63d42">PrivatizeCallbackTy</a> = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function-ref">function&#95;ref</a>&lt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/openmpirbuilder/#af24d1c61cec57095ced3b08a6dd99ee8">InsertPointOrErrorTy</a>(</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00705" /><CodeLine lineNumber="705"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Generator for the control flow structure of an OpenMP canonical loop.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00706" /><CodeLine lineNumber="706"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00707" /><CodeLine lineNumber="707"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This generator operates on the logical iteration space of the loop, i.e.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00708" /><CodeLine lineNumber="708"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the caller only has to provide a loop trip count of the loop as defined by</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00709" /><CodeLine lineNumber="709"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// base language semantics. The trip count is interpreted as an unsigned</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00710" /><CodeLine lineNumber="710"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// integer. The induction variable passed to \\p BodyGenCB will be of the same</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00711" /><CodeLine lineNumber="711"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// type and run from 0 to \\p TripCount - 1 It is up to the callback to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00712" /><CodeLine lineNumber="712"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// convert the logical iteration variable to the loop counter variable in the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00713" /><CodeLine lineNumber="713"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// loop body.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00714" /><CodeLine lineNumber="714"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00715" /><CodeLine lineNumber="715"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param Loc       The insert and source location description. The insert</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00716" /><CodeLine lineNumber="716"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                  location can be between two instructions or the end of a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00717" /><CodeLine lineNumber="717"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                  degenerate block (e.g. a BB under construction).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00718" /><CodeLine lineNumber="718"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param BodyGenCB Callback that will generate the loop body code.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00719" /><CodeLine lineNumber="719"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param TripCount Number of iterations the loop body is executed.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00720" /><CodeLine lineNumber="720"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param Name      Base name used to derive BB and instruction names.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00721" /><CodeLine lineNumber="721"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00722" /><CodeLine lineNumber="722"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\returns An object representing the created control flow structure which</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00723" /><CodeLine lineNumber="723"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///          can be used for loop-associated directives.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00724" /><CodeLine lineNumber="724"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/expected">Expected&lt;CanonicalLoopInfo &#42;&gt;</a></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00725" /><CodeLine lineNumber="725"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/openmpirbuilder/#ae0287686a5ffe03bc264972c862726ea">createCanonicalLoop</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/openmpirbuilder/locationdescription">LocationDescription</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/loc">Loc</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00726" /><CodeLine lineNumber="726"><Highlight kind="normal">                      <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/openmpirbuilder/#a296d2e28bddf1051d614f48b61005899">LoopBodyGenCallbackTy</a> BodyGenCB, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;TripCount,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00727" /><CodeLine lineNumber="727"><Highlight kind="normal">                      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp;Name = </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;loop&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00728" /><CodeLine lineNumber="728"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00729" /><CodeLine lineNumber="729"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Generator for the control flow structure of an OpenMP canonical loop.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00730" /><CodeLine lineNumber="730"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00731" /><CodeLine lineNumber="731"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Instead of a logical iteration space, this allows specifying user-defined</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00732" /><CodeLine lineNumber="732"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// loop counter values using increment, upper- and lower bounds. To</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00733" /><CodeLine lineNumber="733"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// disambiguate the terminology when counting downwards, instead of lower</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00734" /><CodeLine lineNumber="734"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// bounds we use \\p Start for the loop counter value in the first body</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00735" /><CodeLine lineNumber="735"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// iteration.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00736" /><CodeLine lineNumber="736"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00737" /><CodeLine lineNumber="737"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Consider the following limitations:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00738" /><CodeLine lineNumber="738"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00739" /><CodeLine lineNumber="739"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  &#42; A loop counter space over all integer values of its bit-width cannot be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00740" /><CodeLine lineNumber="740"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///    represented. E.g using uint8&#95;t, its loop trip count of 256 cannot be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00741" /><CodeLine lineNumber="741"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///    stored into an 8 bit integer):</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00742" /><CodeLine lineNumber="742"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00743" /><CodeLine lineNumber="743"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///      DO I = 0, 255, 1</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00744" /><CodeLine lineNumber="744"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00745" /><CodeLine lineNumber="745"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  &#42; Unsigned wrapping is only supported when wrapping only &quot;once&quot;; E.g.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00746" /><CodeLine lineNumber="746"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///    effectively counting downwards:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00747" /><CodeLine lineNumber="747"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00748" /><CodeLine lineNumber="748"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///      for (uint8&#95;t i = 100u; i &gt; 0; i += 127u)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00749" /><CodeLine lineNumber="749"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00750" /><CodeLine lineNumber="750"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00751" /><CodeLine lineNumber="751"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// TODO: May need to add additional parameters to represent:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00752" /><CodeLine lineNumber="752"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00753" /><CodeLine lineNumber="753"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  &#42; Allow representing downcounting with unsigned integers.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00754" /><CodeLine lineNumber="754"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00755" /><CodeLine lineNumber="755"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  &#42; Sign of the step and the comparison operator might disagree:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00756" /><CodeLine lineNumber="756"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00757" /><CodeLine lineNumber="757"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///      for (int i = 0; i &lt; 42; i -= 1u)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00758" /><CodeLine lineNumber="758"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00759" /><CodeLine lineNumber="759"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00760" /><CodeLine lineNumber="760"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param Loc       The insert and source location description.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00761" /><CodeLine lineNumber="761"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param BodyGenCB Callback that will generate the loop body code.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00762" /><CodeLine lineNumber="762"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param Start     Value of the loop counter for the first iterations.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00763" /><CodeLine lineNumber="763"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param Stop      Loop counter values past this will stop the loop.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00764" /><CodeLine lineNumber="764"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param Step      Loop counter increment after each iteration; negative</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00765" /><CodeLine lineNumber="765"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                  means counting down.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00766" /><CodeLine lineNumber="766"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param IsSigned  Whether Start, Stop and Step are signed integers.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00767" /><CodeLine lineNumber="767"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param InclusiveStop Whether \\p Stop itself is a valid value for the loop</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00768" /><CodeLine lineNumber="768"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                      counter.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00769" /><CodeLine lineNumber="769"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param ComputeIP Insertion point for instructions computing the trip</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00770" /><CodeLine lineNumber="770"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                  count. Can be used to ensure the trip count is available</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00771" /><CodeLine lineNumber="771"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                  at the outermost loop of a loop nest. If not set,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00772" /><CodeLine lineNumber="772"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                  defaults to the preheader of the generated loop.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00773" /><CodeLine lineNumber="773"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param Name      Base name used to derive BB and instruction names.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00774" /><CodeLine lineNumber="774"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00775" /><CodeLine lineNumber="775"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\returns An object representing the created control flow structure which</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00776" /><CodeLine lineNumber="776"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///          can be used for loop-associated directives.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00777" /><CodeLine lineNumber="777"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/expected">Expected&lt;CanonicalLoopInfo &#42;&gt;</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/openmpirbuilder/#ae0287686a5ffe03bc264972c862726ea">createCanonicalLoop</a>(</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00778" /><CodeLine lineNumber="778"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/openmpirbuilder/locationdescription">LocationDescription</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/loc">Loc</a>, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/openmpirbuilder/#a296d2e28bddf1051d614f48b61005899">LoopBodyGenCallbackTy</a> BodyGenCB,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00780" /><CodeLine lineNumber="780"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/openmpirbuilder/#aafc1886793b898052f87edd7e9fdbaa3">InsertPointTy</a> ComputeIP = &#123;&#125;, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp;Name = </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;loop&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00781" /><CodeLine lineNumber="781"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00782" /><CodeLine lineNumber="782"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Collapse a loop nest into a single loop.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00783" /><CodeLine lineNumber="783"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00784" /><CodeLine lineNumber="784"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Merges loops of a loop nest into a single CanonicalLoopNest representation</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00785" /><CodeLine lineNumber="785"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// that has the same number of innermost loop iterations as the origin loop</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00786" /><CodeLine lineNumber="786"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// nest. The induction variables of the input loops are derived from the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00787" /><CodeLine lineNumber="787"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// collapsed loop&#39;s induction variable. This is intended to be used to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00788" /><CodeLine lineNumber="788"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// implement OpenMP&#39;s collapse clause. Before applying a directive,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00789" /><CodeLine lineNumber="789"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// collapseLoops normalizes a loop nest to contain only a single loop and the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00790" /><CodeLine lineNumber="790"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// directive&#39;s implementation does not need to handle multiple loops itself.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00791" /><CodeLine lineNumber="791"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This does not remove the need to handle all loop nest handling by</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00792" /><CodeLine lineNumber="792"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// directives, such as the ordered(&lt;n&gt;) clause or the simd schedule-clause</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00793" /><CodeLine lineNumber="793"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// modifier of the worksharing-loop directive.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00794" /><CodeLine lineNumber="794"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00795" /><CodeLine lineNumber="795"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Example:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00796" /><CodeLine lineNumber="796"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\code</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00797" /><CodeLine lineNumber="797"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   for (int i = 0; i &lt; 7; ++i) // Canonical loop &quot;i&quot;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00798" /><CodeLine lineNumber="798"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///     for (int j = 0; j &lt; 9; ++j) // Canonical loop &quot;j&quot;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00799" /><CodeLine lineNumber="799"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///       body(i, j);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00800" /><CodeLine lineNumber="800"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\endcode</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00801" /><CodeLine lineNumber="801"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00802" /><CodeLine lineNumber="802"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// After collapsing with Loops=&#123;i,j&#125;, the loop is changed to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00803" /><CodeLine lineNumber="803"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\code</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00804" /><CodeLine lineNumber="804"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   for (int ij = 0; ij &lt; 63; ++ij) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00805" /><CodeLine lineNumber="805"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///     int i = ij / 9;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00806" /><CodeLine lineNumber="806"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///     int j = ij % 9;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00807" /><CodeLine lineNumber="807"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///     body(i, j);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00808" /><CodeLine lineNumber="808"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00809" /><CodeLine lineNumber="809"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\endcode</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00810" /><CodeLine lineNumber="810"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00811" /><CodeLine lineNumber="811"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// In the current implementation, the following limitations apply:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00812" /><CodeLine lineNumber="812"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00813" /><CodeLine lineNumber="813"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  &#42; All input loops have an induction variable of the same type.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00814" /><CodeLine lineNumber="814"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00815" /><CodeLine lineNumber="815"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  &#42; The collapsed loop will have the same trip count integer type as the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00816" /><CodeLine lineNumber="816"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///    input loops. Therefore it is possible that the collapsed loop cannot</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00817" /><CodeLine lineNumber="817"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///    represent all iterations of the input loops. For instance, assuming a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00818" /><CodeLine lineNumber="818"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///    32 bit integer type, and two input loops both iterating 2^16 times, the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00819" /><CodeLine lineNumber="819"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///    theoretical trip count of the collapsed loop would be 2^32 iteration,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00820" /><CodeLine lineNumber="820"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///    which cannot be represented in an 32-bit integer. Behavior is undefined</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00821" /><CodeLine lineNumber="821"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///    in this case.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00822" /><CodeLine lineNumber="822"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00823" /><CodeLine lineNumber="823"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  &#42; The trip counts of every input loop must be available at \\p ComputeIP.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00824" /><CodeLine lineNumber="824"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///    Non-rectangular loops are not yet supported.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00825" /><CodeLine lineNumber="825"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00826" /><CodeLine lineNumber="826"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  &#42; At each nest level, code between a surrounding loop and its nested loop</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00827" /><CodeLine lineNumber="827"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///    is hoisted into the loop body, and such code will be executed more</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00828" /><CodeLine lineNumber="828"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///    often than before collapsing (or not at all if any inner loop iteration</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00829" /><CodeLine lineNumber="829"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///    has a trip count of 0). This is permitted by the OpenMP specification.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00830" /><CodeLine lineNumber="830"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00831" /><CodeLine lineNumber="831"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param DL        Debug location for instructions added for collapsing,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00832" /><CodeLine lineNumber="832"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                  such as instructions to compute/derive the input loop&#39;s</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00833" /><CodeLine lineNumber="833"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                  induction variables.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00834" /><CodeLine lineNumber="834"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param Loops     Loops in the loop nest to collapse. Loops are specified</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00835" /><CodeLine lineNumber="835"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                  from outermost-to-innermost and every control flow of a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00836" /><CodeLine lineNumber="836"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                  loop&#39;s body must pass through its directly nested loop.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00837" /><CodeLine lineNumber="837"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param ComputeIP Where additional instruction that compute the collapsed</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00838" /><CodeLine lineNumber="838"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                  trip count. If not set, defaults to before the generated</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00839" /><CodeLine lineNumber="839"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                  loop.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00840" /><CodeLine lineNumber="840"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00841" /><CodeLine lineNumber="841"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\returns The CanonicalLoopInfo object representing the collapsed loop.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00842" /><CodeLine lineNumber="842"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/canonicalloopinfo">CanonicalLoopInfo</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/openmpirbuilder/#a08610118e213de1b759470f0eafb9b18">collapseLoops</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/debugloc">DebugLoc</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#ad467c4ab9119043f9b7750ab986be61a">DL</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00843" /><CodeLine lineNumber="843"><Highlight kind="normal">                                   <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef&lt;CanonicalLoopInfo &#42;&gt;</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/hexagon/hexagonhardwareloops-cpp/#ada7c1594a393ede3ce32602d64d7ddb2">Loops</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00844" /><CodeLine lineNumber="844"><Highlight kind="normal">                                   <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/openmpirbuilder/#aafc1886793b898052f87edd7e9fdbaa3">InsertPointTy</a> ComputeIP);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00845" /><CodeLine lineNumber="845"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00846" /><CodeLine lineNumber="846"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Get the default alignment value for given target</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00847" /><CodeLine lineNumber="847"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00848" /><CodeLine lineNumber="848"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param TargetTriple   Target triple</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00849" /><CodeLine lineNumber="849"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param Features       StringMap which describes extra CPU features</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00850" /><CodeLine lineNumber="850"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/openmpirbuilder/#ac5b407054e7727d04053af9c3f1a5568">getOpenMPDefaultSimdAlign</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/triple">Triple</a> &amp;TargetTriple,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00851" /><CodeLine lineNumber="851"><Highlight kind="normal">                                            </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringmap">StringMap&lt;bool&gt;</a> &amp;Features);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1073"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Modifies the canonical loop to be a workshare loop.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1074"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1075"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This takes a \\p LoopInfo representing a canonical loop, such as the one</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1076"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// created by \\p createCanonicalLoop and emits additional instructions to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1077"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// turn it into a workshare loop. In particular, it calls to an OpenMP</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1078"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// runtime function in the preheader to obtain the loop bounds to be used in</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1079"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the current thread, updates the relevant instructions in the canonical</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1080"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// loop and calls to an OpenMP runtime finalization function after the loop.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1081"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1082"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The concrete transformation is done by applyStaticWorkshareLoop,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1083"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// applyStaticChunkedWorkshareLoop, or applyDynamicWorkshareLoop, depending</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1084"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// on the value of \\p SchedKind and \\p ChunkSize.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1085"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1086"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param DL       Debug location for instructions added for the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1087"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                 workshare-loop construct itself.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1088"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param CLI      A descriptor of the canonical loop to workshare.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1089"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param AllocaIP An insertion point for Alloca instructions usable in the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1090"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                 preheader of the loop.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1091"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param NeedsBarrier Indicates whether a barrier must be insterted after</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1092"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                     the loop.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1093"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param SchedKind Scheduling algorithm to use.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1094"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param ChunkSize The chunk size for the inner loop.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1095"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param HasSimdModifier Whether the simd modifier is present in the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1096"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                        schedule clause.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1097"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param HasMonotonicModifier Whether the monotonic modifier is present in</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1102"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                         present.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1103"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param LoopType Information about type of loop worksharing.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1104"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                 It corresponds to type of loop workshare OpenMP pragma.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1105"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1106"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\returns Point where to insert code after the workshare construct.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1107"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/openmpirbuilder/#af24d1c61cec57095ced3b08a6dd99ee8">InsertPointOrErrorTy</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/openmpirbuilder/#adaa14806d128ad33bdc48d2bfc46870c">applyWorkshareLoop</a>(</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1116"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1117"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Tile a loop nest.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1118"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1119"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Tiles the loops of \\p Loops by the tile sizes in \\p TileSizes. Loops in</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1120"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\p/ Loops must be perfectly nested, from outermost to innermost loop</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1121"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// (i.e. Loops.front() is the outermost loop). The trip count llvm::Value</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1122"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// of every loop and every tile sizes must be usable in the outermost</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1123"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// loop&#39;s preheader. This implies that the loop nest is rectangular.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1124"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1125"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Example:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1126"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\code</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1127"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   for (int i = 0; i &lt; 15; ++i) // Canonical loop &quot;i&quot;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1128"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///     for (int j = 0; j &lt; 14; ++j) // Canonical loop &quot;j&quot;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1129"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///         body(i, j);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1130"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\endcode</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1131"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1132"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// After tiling with Loops=&#123;i,j&#125; and TileSizes=&#123;5,7&#125;, the loop is changed to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1133"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\code</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1134"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   for (int i1 = 0; i1 &lt; 3; ++i1)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1135"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///     for (int j1 = 0; j1 &lt; 2; ++j1)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1136"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///       for (int i2 = 0; i2 &lt; 5; ++i2)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1137"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///         for (int j2 = 0; j2 &lt; 7; ++j2)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1138"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///           body(i1&#42;3+i2, j1&#42;3+j2);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1139"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\endcode</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1140"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1141"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The returned vector are the loops &#123;i1,j1,i2,j2&#125;. The loops i1 and j1 are</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1142"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// referred to the floor, and the loops i2 and j2 are the tiles. Tiling also</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1143"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// handles non-constant trip counts, non-constant tile sizes and trip counts</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1144"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// that are not multiples of the tile size. In the latter case the tile loop</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1145"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// of the last floor-loop iteration will have fewer iterations than specified</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1146"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// as its tile size.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1147"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1148"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1149"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// @param DL        Debug location for instructions added by tiling, for</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1150"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                  instance the floor- and tile trip count computation.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1151"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// @param Loops     Loops to tile. The CanonicalLoopInfo objects are</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1152"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                  invalidated by this method, i.e. should not used after</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1153"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                  tiling.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1154"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// @param TileSizes For each loop in \\p Loops, the tile size for that</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1155"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                  dimensions.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1156"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1157"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\returns A list of generated loops. Contains twice as many loops as the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1158"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///          input loop nest; the first half are the floor loops and the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1159"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///          second half are the tile loops.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1160"><Highlight kind="normal">  std::vector&lt;CanonicalLoopInfo &#42;&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1161"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/openmpirbuilder/#a76e12ec076e7af4be7b8b77a5d53d3fc">tileLoops</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/debugloc">DebugLoc</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#ad467c4ab9119043f9b7750ab986be61a">DL</a>, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef&lt;CanonicalLoopInfo &#42;&gt;</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/hexagon/hexagonhardwareloops-cpp/#ada7c1594a393ede3ce32602d64d7ddb2">Loops</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1162"><Highlight kind="normal">            <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef&lt;Value &#42;&gt;</a> TileSizes);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1163"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1164"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Fully unroll a loop.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1165"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1166"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Instead of unrolling the loop immediately (and duplicating its body</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1167"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// instructions), it is deferred to LLVM&#39;s LoopUnrollPass by adding loop</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1168"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// metadata.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1169"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1170"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param DL   Debug location for instructions added by unrolling.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1171"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param Loop The loop to unroll. The loop will be invalidated.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1172"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/openmpirbuilder/#a28a2a9806d828609fe107f766d2dd569">unrollLoopFull</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/debugloc">DebugLoc</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#ad467c4ab9119043f9b7750ab986be61a">DL</a>, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/canonicalloopinfo">CanonicalLoopInfo</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1173"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1174"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Fully or partially unroll a loop. How the loop is unrolled is determined</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1175"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// using LLVM&#39;s LoopUnrollPass.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1176"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1177"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param DL   Debug location for instructions added by unrolling.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1178"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param Loop The loop to unroll. The loop will be invalidated.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01179" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1179"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/openmpirbuilder/#a4ca0068cb6a50615c74ecdb8f23839e0">unrollLoopHeuristic</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/debugloc">DebugLoc</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#ad467c4ab9119043f9b7750ab986be61a">DL</a>, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/canonicalloopinfo">CanonicalLoopInfo</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1180"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1181"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Partially unroll a loop.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1182"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01183" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1183"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The CanonicalLoopInfo of the unrolled loop for use with chained</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01184" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1184"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// loop-associated directive can be requested using \\p UnrolledCLI. Not</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01185" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1185"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// needing the CanonicalLoopInfo allows more efficient code generation by</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01186" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1186"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// deferring the actual unrolling to the LoopUnrollPass using loop metadata.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01187" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1187"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// A loop-associated directive applied to the unrolled loop needs to know the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01188" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1188"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// new trip count which means that if using a heuristically determined unroll</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01189" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1189"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// factor (\\p Factor == 0), that factor must be computed immediately. We are</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01190" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1190"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// using the same logic as the LoopUnrollPass to derived the unroll factor,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01191" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1191"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// but which assumes that some canonicalization has taken place (e.g.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01192" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1192"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Mem2Reg, LICM, GVN, Inlining, etc.). That is, the heuristic will perform</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01193" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1193"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// better when the unrolled loop&#39;s CanonicalLoopInfo is not needed.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01194" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1194"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01195" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1195"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param DL          Debug location for instructions added by unrolling.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1196"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param Loop        The loop to unroll. The loop will be invalidated.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1197"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param Factor      The factor to unroll the loop by. A factor of 0</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1198"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                    indicates that a heuristic should be used to determine</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1199"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                    the unroll-factor.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1200"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param UnrolledCLI If non-null, receives the CanonicalLoopInfo of the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1201"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                    partially unrolled loop. Otherwise, uses loop metadata</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1202"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                    to defer unrolling to the LoopUnrollPass.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1203"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/openmpirbuilder/#a5e2b7ac5f48193117a340aa15b085719">unrollLoopPartial</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/debugloc">DebugLoc</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#ad467c4ab9119043f9b7750ab986be61a">DL</a>, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/canonicalloopinfo">CanonicalLoopInfo</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a>, int32&#95;t Factor,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1204"><Highlight kind="normal">                         <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/canonicalloopinfo">CanonicalLoopInfo</a> &#42;&#42;UnrolledCLI);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1205"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1206"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Add metadata to simd-ize a loop. If IfCond is not nullptr, the loop</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1207"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// is cloned. The metadata which prevents vectorization is added to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1208"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// to the cloned loop. The cloned loop is executed when ifCond is evaluated</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1209"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// to false.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1210"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1211"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param Loop        The loop to simd-ize.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1212"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param AlignedVars The map which containts pairs of the pointer</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1213"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                    and its corresponding alignment.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1214"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param IfCond      The value which corresponds to the if clause</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1216"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param Order       The enum to map order clause.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1217"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param Simdlen     The Simdlen length to apply to the simd loop.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1218"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param Safelen     The Safelen length to apply to the simd loop.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1250"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Generator for &#96;#omp task&#96;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1251"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1252"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param Loc The location where the task construct was encountered.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1253"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param AllocaIP The insertion point to be used for alloca instructions.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01254" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1254"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param BodyGenCB Callback that will generate the region code.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01255" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1255"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param Tied True if the task is tied, false if the task is untied.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01256" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1256"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param Final i1 value which is &#96;true&#96; if the task is final, &#96;false&#96; if the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01257" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1257"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///              task is not final.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01258" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1258"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param IfCondition i1 value. If it evaluates to &#96;false&#96;, an undeferred</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01259" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1259"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                    task is generated, and the encountering thread must</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01260" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1260"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                    suspend the current task region, for which execution</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1261"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                    cannot be resumed until execution of the structured</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01262" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1262"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                    block that is associated with the generated task is</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01264" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1264"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param EventHandle If present, signifies the event handle as part of</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01266" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1266"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param Mergeable   If the given task is &#96;mergeable&#96;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01267" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1267"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param priority &#96;priority-value&#39; specifies the execution order of the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01268" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1268"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                 tasks that is generated by the construct</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01353" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1353"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/targetstackid/#a71392100eb15ba746b1f898986f5d8a5">Value</a> &#42;Variable;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01358" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1358"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// Reduction evaluation kind - scalar, complex or aggregate.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01359" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1359"><Highlight kind="normal">    EvalKind EvaluationKind;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01360" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1360"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01361" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1361"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// Callback for generating the reduction body. The IR produced by this will</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01362" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1362"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// be used to combine two values in a thread-safe context, e.g., under</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01363" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1363"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// lock or within the same thread, and therefore need not be atomic.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01364" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1364"><Highlight kind="normal">    ReductionGenCBTy ReductionGen;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01365" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1365"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01366" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1366"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// Clang callback for generating the reduction body. The IR produced by</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01367" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1367"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// this will be used to combine two values in a thread-safe context, e.g.,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01368" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1368"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// under lock or within the same thread, and therefore need not be atomic.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01369" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1369"><Highlight kind="normal">    ReductionGenClangCBTy ReductionGenClang;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01370" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1370"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01371" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1371"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// Callback for generating the atomic reduction body, may be null. The IR</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01372" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1372"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// produced by this will be used to atomically combine two values during</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01373" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1373"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// reduction. If null, the implementation will use the non-atomic version</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01374" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1374"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// along with the appropriate synchronization mechanisms.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01375" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1375"><Highlight kind="normal">    ReductionGenAtomicCBTy AtomicReductionGen;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01376" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1376"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01377" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1377"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01378" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1378"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">enum class</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> CopyAction : </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01412" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1412"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01413" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1413"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This function creates calls to one of two shuffle functions to copy</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01414" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1414"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// variables between lanes in a warp.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01415" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1415"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a066e2a31a13d6520e52ae1944f194662">Value</a> &#42;createRuntimeShuffleFunction(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/openmpirbuilder/#aafc1886793b898052f87edd7e9fdbaa3">InsertPointTy</a> AllocaIP, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a066e2a31a13d6520e52ae1944f194662">Value</a> &#42;Element,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01416" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1416"><Highlight kind="normal">                                      <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/demangle/itaniumdemangle-h/#a88ee8e4eea43084bd8964682683da88caa1fa27779242b4902f7ae3bdd5c6d508">Type</a> &#42;ElementType, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a066e2a31a13d6520e52ae1944f194662">Value</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a05f5b9a11bdcc5feba62899f95dcf878a3134224cba2545bc57954d3b072aebb4">Offset</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01419" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1419"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> shuffleAndStore(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/openmpirbuilder/#aafc1886793b898052f87edd7e9fdbaa3">InsertPointTy</a> AllocaIP, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a066e2a31a13d6520e52ae1944f194662">Value</a> &#42;SrcAddr, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a066e2a31a13d6520e52ae1944f194662">Value</a> &#42;DstAddr,</Highlight></CodeLine>
