<Link id="l02911" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2911"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Emit the user-defined mapper function. The code generation follows the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02912" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2912"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// pattern in the example below.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02913" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2913"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\code</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02914" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2914"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// void .omp&#95;mapper.&lt;type&#95;name&gt;.&lt;mapper&#95;id&gt;.(void &#42;rt&#95;mapper&#95;handle,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02915" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2915"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                                           void &#42;base, void &#42;begin,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02916" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2916"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                                           int64&#95;t size, int64&#95;t type,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02917" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2917"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                                           void &#42;name = nullptr) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02918" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2918"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   // Allocate space for an array section first or add a base/begin for</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02919" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2919"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   // pointer dereference.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02920" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2920"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   if ((size &gt; 1 || (base != begin &amp;&amp; maptype.IsPtrAndObj)) &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02921" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2921"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///       !maptype.IsDelete)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02922" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2922"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///     &#95;&#95;tgt&#95;push&#95;mapper&#95;component(rt&#95;mapper&#95;handle, base, begin,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02923" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2923"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                                 size&#42;sizeof(Ty), clearToFromMember(type));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02924" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2924"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   // Map members.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02925" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2925"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   for (unsigned i = 0; i &lt; size; i++) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02926" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2926"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///     // For each component specified by this mapper:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02927" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2927"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///     for (auto c : begin&#91;i&#93;-&gt;all&#95;components) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02928" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2928"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///       if (c.hasMapper())</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02929" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2929"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///         (&#42;c.Mapper())(rt&#95;mapper&#95;handle, c.arg&#95;base, c.arg&#95;begin,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02930" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2930"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///         c.arg&#95;size,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02931" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2931"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                       c.arg&#95;type, c.arg&#95;name);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02932" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2932"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///       else</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02933" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2933"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///         &#95;&#95;tgt&#95;push&#95;mapper&#95;component(rt&#95;mapper&#95;handle, c.arg&#95;base,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02934" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2934"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                                     c.arg&#95;begin, c.arg&#95;size, c.arg&#95;type,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02935" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2935"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                                     c.arg&#95;name);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02936" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2936"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///     &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02937" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2937"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02938" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2938"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   // Delete the array section.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02939" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2939"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   if (size &gt; 1 &amp;&amp; maptype.IsDelete)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02940" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2940"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///     &#95;&#95;tgt&#95;push&#95;mapper&#95;component(rt&#95;mapper&#95;handle, base, begin,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02941" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2941"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                                 size&#42;sizeof(Ty), clearToFromMember(type));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02942" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2942"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02943" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2943"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\endcode</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02944" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2944"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02945" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2945"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param PrivAndGenMapInfoCB Callback that privatizes code and populates the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02946" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2946"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// MapInfos and returns.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02947" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2947"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param ElemTy DeclareMapper element type.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02948" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2948"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param FuncName Optional param to specify mapper function name.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02949" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2949"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param CustomMapperCB Optional callback to generate code related to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02950" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2950"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// custom mappers.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02951" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2951"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/codeview/#adfebd8c4ae29ccd84c600c1e65d6b807a86408593c34af77fdd90df932f8b5261">Function</a> &#42;emitUserDefinedMapper(</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02952" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2952"><Highlight kind="normal">      function&#95;ref&lt;MapInfosTy &amp;(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/openmpirbuilder/#aafc1886793b898052f87edd7e9fdbaa3">InsertPointTy</a> CodeGenIP, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a066e2a31a13d6520e52ae1944f194662">llvm::Value</a> &#42;PtrPHI,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02957" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2957"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02958" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2958"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Generator for &#39;#omp target data&#39;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02959" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2959"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02960" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2960"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param Loc The location where the target data construct was encountered.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02961" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2961"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param AllocaIP The insertion points to be used for alloca instructions.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02962" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2962"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param CodeGenIP The insertion point at which the target directive code</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02963" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2963"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// should be placed.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02964" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2964"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param IsBegin If true then emits begin mapper call otherwise emits</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02965" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2965"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// end mapper call.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02966" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2966"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param DeviceID Stores the DeviceID from the device clause.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02967" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2967"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param IfCond Value which corresponds to the if clause condition.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02968" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2968"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param Info Stores all information realted to the Target Data directive.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02969" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2969"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param GenMapInfoCB Callback that populates the MapInfos and returns.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02970" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2970"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param BodyGenCB Optional Callback to generate the region code.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02971" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2971"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param DeviceAddrCB Optional callback to generate code related to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02972" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2972"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// use&#95;device&#95;ptr and use&#95;device&#95;addr.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02973" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2973"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param CustomMapperCB Optional callback to generate code related to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02974" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2974"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// custom mappers.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02975" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2975"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/openmpirbuilder/#af24d1c61cec57095ced3b08a6dd99ee8">InsertPointOrErrorTy</a> createTargetData(</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02976" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2976"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/openmpirbuilder/locationdescription">LocationDescription</a> &amp;Loc, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/openmpirbuilder/#aafc1886793b898052f87edd7e9fdbaa3">InsertPointTy</a> AllocaIP,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02977" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2977"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/openmpirbuilder/#aafc1886793b898052f87edd7e9fdbaa3">InsertPointTy</a> CodeGenIP, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a066e2a31a13d6520e52ae1944f194662">Value</a> &#42;DeviceID, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a066e2a31a13d6520e52ae1944f194662">Value</a> &#42;IfCond,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02978" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2978"><Highlight kind="normal">      TargetDataInfo &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/cseinfo-cpp/#a75f8a8519c2c9b30e7c06dc5e256fffa">Info</a>, GenMapInfoCallbackTy GenMapInfoCB,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3048"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Declarations for LLVM-IR types (simple, array, function and structure) are</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3049"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// generated below. Their names are defined and used in OpenMPKinds.def. Here</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3050"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// we provide the declarations, the initializeTypes function will provide the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3051"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// values.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3052"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3053"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///&#123;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3054"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#define OMP&#95;TYPE(VarName, InitValue) Type &#42;VarName = nullptr;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3055"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#define OMP&#95;ARRAY&#95;TYPE(VarName, ElemTy, ArraySize)                             \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3056"><Highlight kind="preprocessor">  ArrayType &#42;VarName##Ty = nullptr;                                            \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3057"><Highlight kind="preprocessor">  PointerType &#42;VarName##PtrTy = nullptr;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3058"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#define OMP&#95;FUNCTION&#95;TYPE(VarName, IsVarArg, ReturnType, ...)                  \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3059"><Highlight kind="preprocessor">  FunctionType &#42;VarName = nullptr;                                             \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3060"><Highlight kind="preprocessor">  PointerType &#42;VarName##Ptr = nullptr;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3061"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#define OMP&#95;STRUCT&#95;TYPE(VarName, StrName, ...)                                 \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3062"><Highlight kind="preprocessor">  StructType &#42;VarName = nullptr;                                               \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3063"><Highlight kind="preprocessor">  PointerType &#42;VarName##Ptr = nullptr;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3064"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#include &quot;llvm/Frontend/OpenMP/OMPKinds.def&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3065"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3143"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Callback type for Atomic Expression update</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3171"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Emit atomic update for constructs: X = X BinOp Expr ,or X = Expr BinOp X</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3172"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// For complex Operations: X = UpdateOp(X) =&gt; CmpExch X, old&#95;X, UpdateOp(X)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3173"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Only Scalar data types.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3174"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03184" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3184"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                   or belong to &#123;FADD, FSUB, BAD&#95;BINOP&#125;.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03185" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3185"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                   Then a &#96;cmpExch&#96; based  atomic will be generated.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03186" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3186"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param UpdateOp   Code generator for complex expressions that cannot be</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03188" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3188"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param VolatileX       true if \\a X volatile?</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03269" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3269"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Emit atomic update for constructs: --- Only Scalar data types</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03270" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3270"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// V = X; X = X BinOp Expr ,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03271" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3271"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// X = X BinOp Expr; V = X,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03272" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3272"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// V = X; X = Expr BinOp X,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03273" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3273"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// X = Expr BinOp X; V = X,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03274" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3274"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// V = X; X = UpdateOp(X),</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03275" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3275"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// X = UpdateOp(X); V = X,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03276" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3276"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03277" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3277"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param Loc        The insert and source location description.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03278" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3278"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param AllocaIP   The insertion point to be used for alloca instructions.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03279" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3279"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param X          The target atomic pointer to be updated</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03280" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3280"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param V          Memory address where to store captured value</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03281" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3281"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param Expr       The value to update X with.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03282" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3282"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param AO         Atomic ordering of the generated atomic instructions</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03283" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3283"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param RMWOp      The binary operation used for update. If</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03284" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3284"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                   operation is not supported by atomicRMW, or belong to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03285" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3285"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                   &#123;FADD, FSUB, BAD&#95;BINOP&#125;. Then a cmpExch based</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03286" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3286"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                   atomic will be generated.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03287" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3287"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param UpdateOp   Code generator for complex expressions that cannot be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03288" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3288"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                   expressed through atomicrmw instruction.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03289" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3289"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param UpdateExpr true if X is an in place update of the form</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03290" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3290"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                   X = X BinOp Expr or X = Expr BinOp X</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03291" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3291"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param IsXBinopExpr true if X is Left H.S. in Right H.S. part of the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03292" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3292"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                     update expression, false otherwise.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03293" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3293"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                     (e.g. true for X = X BinOp Expr)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03294" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3294"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param IsPostfixUpdate true if original value of &#39;x&#39; must be stored in</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03295" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3295"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                        &#39;v&#39;, not an updated one.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03296" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3296"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03297" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3297"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\return Insertion point after generated atomic capture IR.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03305" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3305"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Emit atomic compare for constructs: --- Only scalar data types</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03306" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3306"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// cond-expr-stmt:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03307" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3307"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// x = x ordop expr ? expr : x;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03308" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3308"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// x = expr ordop x ? expr : x;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03309" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3309"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// x = x == e ? d : x;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03310" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3310"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// x = e == x ? d : x; (this one is not in the spec)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03311" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3311"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// cond-update-stmt:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03312" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3312"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// if (x ordop expr) &#123; x = expr; &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03313" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3313"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// if (expr ordop x) &#123; x = expr; &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03314" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3314"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// if (x == e) &#123; x = d; &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03315" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3315"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// if (e == x) &#123; x = d; &#125; (this one is not in the spec)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03316" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3316"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// conditional-update-capture-atomic:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03317" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3317"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// v = x; cond-update-stmt; (IsPostfixUpdate=true, IsFailOnly=false)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03318" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3318"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// cond-update-stmt; v = x; (IsPostfixUpdate=false, IsFailOnly=false)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03319" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3319"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// if (x == e) &#123; x = d; &#125; else &#123; v = x; &#125; (IsPostfixUpdate=false,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03320" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3320"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                                         IsFailOnly=true)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03321" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3321"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// r = x == e; if (r) &#123; x = d; &#125; (IsPostfixUpdate=false, IsFailOnly=false)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03322" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3322"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// r = x == e; if (r) &#123; x = d; &#125; else &#123; v = x; &#125; (IsPostfixUpdate=false,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03323" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3323"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                                                IsFailOnly=true)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03324" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3324"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03325" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3325"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param Loc          The insert and source location description.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03326" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3326"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param X            The target atomic pointer to be updated.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03327" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3327"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param V            Memory address where to store captured value (for</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03328" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3328"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                     compare capture only).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03329" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3329"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param R            Memory address where to store comparison result</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03330" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3330"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                     (for compare capture with &#39;==&#39; only).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03331" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3331"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param E            The expected value (&#39;e&#39;) for forms that use an</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03332" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3332"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                     equality comparison or an expression (&#39;expr&#39;) for</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03333" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3333"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                     forms that use &#39;ordop&#39; (logically an atomic maximum or</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03334" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3334"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                     minimum).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03335" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3335"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param D            The desired value for forms that use an equality</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03336" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3336"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                     comparison. If forms that use &#39;ordop&#39;, it should be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3337"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                     \\p nullptr.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03338" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3338"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param AO           Atomic ordering of the generated atomic instructions.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03339" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3339"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param Op           Atomic compare operation. It can only be ==, &lt;, or &gt;.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03340" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3340"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param IsXBinopExpr True if the conditional statement is in the form where</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03341" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3341"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                     x is on LHS. It only matters for &lt; or &gt;.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03342" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3342"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param IsPostfixUpdate  True if original value of &#39;x&#39; must be stored in</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03343" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3343"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                         &#39;v&#39;, not an updated one (for compare capture</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03344" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3344"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                         only).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03345" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3345"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param IsFailOnly   True if the original value of &#39;x&#39; is stored to &#39;v&#39;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03346" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3346"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                     only when the comparison fails. This is only valid for</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03347" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3347"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                     the case the comparison is &#39;==&#39;.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03348" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3348"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03349" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3349"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\return Insertion point after generated atomic capture IR.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03350" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3350"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/openmpirbuilder/#aafc1886793b898052f87edd7e9fdbaa3">InsertPointTy</a></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03363" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3363"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Create the control flow structure of a canonical OpenMP loop.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03364" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3364"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03365" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3365"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The emitted loop will be disconnected, i.e. no edge to the loop&#39;s</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03366" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3366"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// preheader and no terminator in the AfterBB. The OpenMPIRBuilder&#39;s</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03367" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3367"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// IRBuilder location is not preserved.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03368" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3368"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03369" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3369"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param DL        DebugLoc used for the instructions in the skeleton.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03370" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3370"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param TripCount Value to be used for the trip count.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03371" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3371"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param F         Function in which to insert the BasicBlocks.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03372" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3372"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param PreInsertBefore  Where to insert BBs that execute before the body,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03373" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3373"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                         typically the body itself.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03374" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3374"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param PostInsertBefore Where to insert BBs that execute after the body.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03375" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3375"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param Name      Base name used to derive BB</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03376" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3376"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                  and instruction names.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03377" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3377"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03378" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3378"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\returns The CanonicalLoopInfo that represents the emitted loop.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03379" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3379"><Highlight kind="normal">  CanonicalLoopInfo &#42;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/openmpirbuilder/#a445fa52d77040bccb16bfea111234a2e">createLoopSkeleton</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/dwarf-linker/#a463a58e257d5f6fb2c39eb9a2474fc24ac2e06fc138163b7095fa483616a0a47a">DebugLoc</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#ad467c4ab9119043f9b7750ab986be61a">DL</a>, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a066e2a31a13d6520e52ae1944f194662">Value</a> &#42;TripCount,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03387" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3387"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Loads all the offload entries information from the host IR</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03388" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3388"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// metadata. This function is only meant to be used with device code</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03395" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3395"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Loads all the offload entries information from the host IR</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03396" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3396"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// metadata read from the file passed in as the HostFilePath argument. This</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03398" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3398"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03399" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3399"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param HostFilePath The path to the host IR file,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03400" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3400"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// used to load in offload metadata for the device, allowing host and device</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03401" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3401"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// to maintain the same metadata mapping.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03402" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3402"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/openmpirbuilder/#a2242b144e54fa6203dae5c5b27fff17c">loadOffloadInfoMetadata</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> HostFilePath);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03403" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3403"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03404" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3404"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Gets (if variable with the given name already exist) or creates</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03405" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3405"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// internal global variable with the specified Name. The created variable has</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03413" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3413"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03414" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3414"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Class to represented the control flow structure of an OpenMP canonical loop.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03415" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3415"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03416" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3416"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The control-flow structure is standardized for easy consumption by</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03417" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3417"><Highlight kind="comment">/// directives associated with loops. For instance, the worksharing-loop</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03418" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3418"><Highlight kind="comment">/// construct may change this control flow such that each loop iteration is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03419" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3419"><Highlight kind="comment">/// executed on only one thread. The constraints of a canonical loop in brief</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03420" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3420"><Highlight kind="comment">/// are:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03421" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3421"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03422" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3422"><Highlight kind="comment">///  &#42; The number of loop iterations must have been computed before entering the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03423" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3423"><Highlight kind="comment">///    loop.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03424" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3424"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03425" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3425"><Highlight kind="comment">///  &#42; Has an (unsigned) logical induction variable that starts at zero and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03426" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3426"><Highlight kind="comment">///    increments by one.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03427" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3427"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03428" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3428"><Highlight kind="comment">///  &#42; The loop&#39;s CFG itself has no side-effects. The OpenMP specification</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03429" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3429"><Highlight kind="comment">///    itself allows side-effects, but the order in which they happen, including</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03430" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3430"><Highlight kind="comment">///    how often or whether at all, is unspecified. We expect that the frontend</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03431" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3431"><Highlight kind="comment">///    will emit those side-effect instructions somewhere (e.g. before the loop)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03432" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3432"><Highlight kind="comment">///    such that the CanonicalLoopInfo itself can be side-effect free.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03433" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3433"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03434" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3434"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Keep in mind that CanonicalLoopInfo is meant to only describe a repeated</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03435" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3435"><Highlight kind="comment">/// execution of a loop body that satifies these constraints. It does NOT</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03436" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3436"><Highlight kind="comment">/// represent arbitrary SESE regions that happen to contain a loop. Do not use</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03437" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3437"><Highlight kind="comment">/// CanonicalLoopInfo for such purposes.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03438" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3438"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03439" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3439"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The control flow can be described as follows:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03440" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3440"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03441" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3441"><Highlight kind="comment">///     Preheader</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03442" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3442"><Highlight kind="comment">///        |</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03443" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3443"><Highlight kind="comment">///  /-&gt; Header</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03444" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3444"><Highlight kind="comment">///  |     |</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03445" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3445"><Highlight kind="comment">///  |    Cond---\\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03446" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3446"><Highlight kind="comment">///  |     |     |</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03447" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3447"><Highlight kind="comment">///  |    Body   |</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03448" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3448"><Highlight kind="comment">///  |    | |    |</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03449" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3449"><Highlight kind="comment">///  |   &lt;...&gt;   |</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03450" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3450"><Highlight kind="comment">///  |    | |    |</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03451" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3451"><Highlight kind="comment">///   \\--Latch   |</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03452" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3452"><Highlight kind="comment">///              |</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03453" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3453"><Highlight kind="comment">///             Exit</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03454" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3454"><Highlight kind="comment">///              |</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03455" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3455"><Highlight kind="comment">///            After</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03456" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3456"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03457" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3457"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The loop is thought to start at PreheaderIP (at the Preheader&#39;s terminator,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03458" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3458"><Highlight kind="comment">/// including) and end at AfterIP (at the After&#39;s first instruction, excluding).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03459" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3459"><Highlight kind="comment">/// That is, instructions in the Preheader and After blocks (except the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03460" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3460"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Preheader&#39;s terminator) are out of CanonicalLoopInfo&#39;s control and may have</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03461" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3461"><Highlight kind="comment">/// side-effects. Typically, the Preheader is used to compute the loop&#39;s trip</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03462" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3462"><Highlight kind="comment">/// count. The instructions from BodyIP (at the Body block&#39;s first instruction,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03463" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3463"><Highlight kind="comment">/// excluding) until the Latch are also considered outside CanonicalLoopInfo&#39;s</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03464" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3464"><Highlight kind="comment">/// control and thus can have side-effects. The body block is the single entry</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03465" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3465"><Highlight kind="comment">/// point into the loop body, which may contain arbitrary control flow as long</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03466" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3466"><Highlight kind="comment">/// as all control paths eventually branch to the Latch block.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03467" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3467"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03468" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3468"><Highlight kind="comment">/// TODO: Consider adding another standardized BasicBlock between Body CFG and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03469" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3469"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Latch to guarantee that there is only a single edge to the latch. It would</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03470" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3470"><Highlight kind="comment">/// make loop transformations easier to not needing to consider multiple</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03471" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3471"><Highlight kind="comment">/// predecessors of the latch (See redirectAllPredecessorsTo) and would give us</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03472" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3472"><Highlight kind="comment">/// an equivalant to PreheaderIP, AfterIP and BodyIP for inserting code that</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03473" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3473"><Highlight kind="comment">/// executes after each body iteration.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03474" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3474"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03475" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3475"><Highlight kind="comment">/// There must be no loop-carried dependencies through llvm::Values. This is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03476" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3476"><Highlight kind="comment">/// equivalant to that the Latch has no PHINode and the Header&#39;s only PHINode is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03477" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3477"><Highlight kind="comment">/// for the induction variable.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03478" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3478"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03479" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3479"><Highlight kind="comment">/// All code in Header, Cond, Latch and Exit (plus the terminator of the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03480" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3480"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Preheader) are CanonicalLoopInfo&#39;s responsibility and their build-up checked</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03481" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3481"><Highlight kind="comment">/// by assertOK(). They are expected to not be modified unless explicitly</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03482" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3482"><Highlight kind="comment">/// modifying the CanonicalLoopInfo through a methods that applies a OpenMP</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03483" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3483"><Highlight kind="comment">/// loop-associated construct such as applyWorkshareLoop, tileLoops, unrollLoop,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03484" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3484"><Highlight kind="comment">/// etc. These methods usually invalidate the CanonicalLoopInfo and re-use its</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03485" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3485"><Highlight kind="comment">/// basic blocks. After invalidation, the CanonicalLoopInfo must not be used</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03486" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3486"><Highlight kind="comment">/// anymore as its underlying control flow may not exist anymore.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03487" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3487"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Loop-transformation methods such as tileLoops, collapseLoops and unrollLoop</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03488" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3488"><Highlight kind="comment">/// may also return a new CanonicalLoopInfo that can be passed to other</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03489" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3489"><Highlight kind="comment">/// loop-associated construct implementing methods. These loop-transforming</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03490" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3490"><Highlight kind="comment">/// methods may either create a new CanonicalLoopInfo usually using</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03491" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3491"><Highlight kind="comment">/// createLoopSkeleton and invalidate the input CanonicalLoopInfo, or reuse and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03492" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3492"><Highlight kind="comment">/// modify one of the input CanonicalLoopInfo and return it as representing the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03493" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3493"><Highlight kind="comment">/// modified loop. What is done is an implementation detail of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03494" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3494"><Highlight kind="comment">/// transformation-implementing method and callers should always assume that the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03495" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3495"><Highlight kind="comment">/// CanonicalLoopInfo passed to it is invalidated and a new object is returned.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03496" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3496"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Returned CanonicalLoopInfo have the same structure and guarantees as the one</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03497" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3497"><Highlight kind="comment">/// created by createCanonicalLoop, such that transforming methods do not have</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03498" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3498"><Highlight kind="comment">/// to special case where the CanonicalLoopInfo originated from.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03499" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3499"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03500" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3500"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Generally, methods consuming CanonicalLoopInfo do not need an</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03501" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3501"><Highlight kind="comment">/// OpenMPIRBuilder::InsertPointTy as argument, but use the locations of the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03502" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3502"><Highlight kind="comment">/// CanonicalLoopInfo to insert new or modify existing instructions. Unless</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03503" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3503"><Highlight kind="comment">/// documented otherwise, methods consuming CanonicalLoopInfo do not invalidate</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03504" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3504"><Highlight kind="comment">/// any InsertPoint that is outside CanonicalLoopInfo&#39;s control. Specifically,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03505" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3505"><Highlight kind="comment">/// any InsertPoint in the Preheader, After or Block can still be used after</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03506" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3506"><Highlight kind="comment">/// calling such a method.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03507" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3507"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03508" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3508"><Highlight kind="comment">/// TODO: Provide mechanisms for exception handling and cancellation points.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03509" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3509"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03510" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3510"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Defined outside OpenMPIRBuilder because nested classes cannot be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03511" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3511"><Highlight kind="comment">/// forward-declared, e.g. to avoid having to include the entire OMPIRBuilder.h.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03512" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3512" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/canonicalloopinfo"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/canonicalloopinfo">CanonicalLoopInfo</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03513" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3513" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/canonicalloopinfo/#a1ce8ab76394bc6773081e7634cd20625"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">friend</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/canonicalloopinfo/#a1ce8ab76394bc6773081e7634cd20625">OpenMPIRBuilder</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03514" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3514"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03515" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3515"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">private</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">:</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03521" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3521"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Add the control blocks of this loop to \\p BBs.</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03530" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3530"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03531" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3531"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Sets the number of loop iterations to the given value. This value must be</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03535" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3535"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03536" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3536"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Replace all uses of the canonical induction variable in the loop body with</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03537" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3537"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// a new one.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03538" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3538"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03539" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3539"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The intended use case is to update the induction variable for an updated</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03540" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3540"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// iteration space such that it can stay normalized in the 0...tripcount-1</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03541" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3541"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// range.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03542" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3542"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03543" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3543"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The \\p Updater is called with the (presumable updated) current normalized</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03544" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3544"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// induction variable and is expected to return the value that uses of the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03545" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3545"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// pre-updated induction values should use instead, typically dependent on</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03546" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3546"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the new induction variable. This is a lambda (instead of e.g. just passing</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03547" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3547"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the new value) to be able to distinguish the uses of the pre-updated</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03548" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3548"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// induction variable and uses of the induction varible to compute the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03549" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3549"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// updated induction variable value.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03550" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3550"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> mapIndVar(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function-ref">llvm::function&#95;ref</a>&lt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42;)&gt; Updater);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03551" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3551"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03552" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3552"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">:</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03553" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3553"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Returns whether this object currently represents the IR of a loop. If</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03554" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3554"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// returning false, it may have been consumed by a loop transformation or not</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03555" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3555"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// been intialized. Do not use in this case;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03556" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3556" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/canonicalloopinfo/#a4b2b7074e300c251f7cb8913620b1d80"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/canonicalloopinfo/#a4b2b7074e300c251f7cb8913620b1d80">isValid</a>()</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"> const </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Header; &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03557" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3557"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03558" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3558"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The preheader ensures that there is only a single edge entering the loop.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03559" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3559"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Code that must be execute before any loop iteration can be emitted here,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03560" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3560"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// such as computing the loop trip count and begin lifetime markers. Code in</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03561" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3561"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the preheader is not considered part of the canonical loop.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03562" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3562"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/canonicalloopinfo/#ad50eb30e70ff2a9ea7f220547e2b6f6d">getPreheader</a>() </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03563" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3563"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03564" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3564"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The header is the entry for each iteration. In the canonical control flow,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03565" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3565"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// it only contains the PHINode for the induction variable.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03566" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3566" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/canonicalloopinfo/#a01c4471afa921c4962d7138cfcef4942"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/canonicalloopinfo/#a01c4471afa921c4962d7138cfcef4942">getHeader</a>()</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"> const </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03568" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3568"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Header;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03570" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3570"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03571" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3571"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The condition block computes whether there is another loop iteration. If</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03572" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3572"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// yes, branches to the body; otherwise to the exit block.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03577" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3577"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03578" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3578"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The body block is the single entry for a loop iteration and not controlled</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03579" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3579"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// by CanonicalLoopInfo. It can contain arbitrary control flow but must</Highlight></CodeLine>
